title: European Landmarks Recall
description: Test your memory of Europe's most iconic landmarks, from ancient monuments to modern marvels.

questions.question: In which city would you find the Colosseum, an ancient amphitheater built nearly 2,000 years ago?
The Sagrada Família, a famous basilica designed by Antoni Gaudí, is located in which Spanish city?
Which European landmark is a prehistoric monument consisting of a ring of standing stones in Wiltshire, England?
The Parthenon, an ancient temple dedicated to the goddess Athena, sits atop the Acropolis in which city?
Which famous bridge in Prague is lined with 30 Baroque statues and was completed in the early 15th century?
The Alhambra, a stunning Moorish palace and fortress complex, is located in which Spanish city?
In which Scandinavian capital would you find the Vasa Museum, housing a 17th-century warship?
The Brandenburg Gate, a symbol of German reunification, is located in which city?
Which famous Italian landmark is known for its unintended tilt, caused by soft ground on one side?
The Blue Mosque, known for its blue-tiled interior, is a famous landmark in which city?
Which Gothic cathedral in Paris suffered a major fire in April 2019?
The Anne Frank House, a museum dedicated to the famous wartime diarist, is located in which city?
Which Scottish castle sits atop Castle Rock, a volcanic plug in the heart of Edinburgh?
The Trevi Fountain, where visitors toss coins for good luck, is located in which European city?
Which famous Greek island is known for its blue-domed churches and stunning sunsets over the caldera?
